isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-02 - New Bolt Tightening Procedure For Supply Manifold

subjectgroup.subject: New Bolt Tightening Procedure For Supply Manifold

configure.engfam: The International® 530E Green Diesel Technology™ 1194039 and above

geninfo.para: A new torque sequence and re-torque step is implemented for installation of the supply manifold on all electronic I6 engine models (engine serial number 943054 and above). Reason for new torque sequence and re-torque step is to achieve a better seal on the supply manifold.

step1.para: Refer to the appropriate service manual for the engine model being serviced:

verbatim.line: DT 466E, International® 530E, and The International® 530E With Green Diesel Technology™

step1.para: Inspect oil manifold for leakage. If gasket shows no sign of leakage, immediately proceed to Step 3. If leakage has occurred the gasket must be replaced. Refer to the service manual for complete removal and installation procedures for the supply manifold gasket. These procedures remain unchanged except for this new torque sequence and re-torque step.
Torque the 12 bolts to 27 N·m (20 lbf·ft) in the sequence pattern as seen in Figure 1 starting with bolt 1.
This new torque sequence requires a re-torque step. Repeat the torque sequence a second time to make sure that the supply manifold bolts are properly torqued to the specified torque value.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Torque Sequence for Supply Manifold
